@hpierrejacques People seem to use the word "asset" for both:

1) A thing they plan to resell someday that might hold its value.

2) A thing that actually *produces cash*

This leads to confusion and overspending. Personal Residences are expenses not investments.

@fortworthchris Reverse might be true for many businesses these days

One thinks they move toward things in the future.

Second thinks the future moves toward us.

This is a question that separates people who have two different perceptions of how time passes:

- Ego-centered perception of time
- Time-centered perception

If I say to you:

"Wednesday's meeting at noon has been moved forward by two hours"

What time do you think the meeting will be?
